content.stem: What inference can be made about the narrator's feelings toward the main problem of mail delivery established in the text? Support your answer with details from the text.

rubric.name: Rubric 2
rubric.val:
The response:
* gives sufficient details of the ability to make an inference about the narrator's feelings
* includes specific feelings of the narrator that relate to the main problem of mail delivery
* adequately supports the inference with clearly relevant details from the text

sample.name: 2-Point Official Sample Answer
sample.samplecontent: The narrator is determined to deliver the mail. First the tells Mr. Smyth that the “mail has to arrive at the correct destination, and I intend to deliver it.” Then the narrator tells Mr. Smyth that because Lincoln was just elected president of the United States, there could be very important information in the mail. Finally the narrator says, “Our orders are to deliver the mail on time, regardless of what happened to Lefty.” The narrator believes that the job will get done.

rubric.name: Rubric 1
rubric.val:
The response:
* gives limited evidence of the ability to make an inference about the narrator's feelings
* includes general feelings of the narrator that relate to the main problem of mail delivery
* supports the inference with limited details from the text

sample.name: 1-Point Official Sample Answer
sample.samplecontent: The narrator is energized to deliver the mail. The narrator thinks that delivering the mail is important and an adventure. The narrator is excited about riding a horse for this task.

rubric.name: Rubric 0
rubric.val: A response gets no credit if it provides no evidence of the ability to make an inference about the narrator's feelings, includes no feelings of the narrator that relate ot the main problem of the mail delivery, and includes no relevant information from the text.

sample.name: 0-Point Official Sample Answer
sample.samplecontent: The narrator had not ridden a horse before and expresses fear about riding the horse. I rode a horse once and I felt the same way but once I rode the horse I did not feel as nervous. I continued to practice so I could get better at riding horses.
